reviews.text: I had the opportunity of being on top the Sears tower once in my lifetime years back. It's very quiet up there because you're very high in the sky. I was expecting something like New York City and the top of a high skyscraper there. However that was not the case. There are not many tall buildings in Chicago like there is New York. The observation deck is windy and the sites are endless. If you're in downtown Chicago it's certainly worth the elevator ride for sure.  My adventure was at night so I recommend doing it during the day as well. It's a great place to bring the family.

I would recommend you do not go between 3 and sunset! Great place to take a cool picture and the walls are painted with funny sayings. But your waiting in line to ride up a fast elevator and look out a window. I wish it included the history of when it was the Sears tower since Sears played such a large part in the American economy for such a long time. RIP Sears and all other outlet stores.

The line was incredibly worth it! Seeing that view alone was mesmerizing, but being able to see it from a glass box hanging on the side of a building was exhilarating! Amazing photo opportunity also to keep as a memory so don't forget to keep your phone handy. Definitely recommend while staying in Chicago.

Really cool experience. I went on a Monday in March so queues weren't bad at all. Some pretty cool views although you can't see Navy Pier. The sky deck is freaky but great experience. Well worth the visit.

The line was incredibly worth it! Seeing that view alone was mesmerizing, but being able to see it from a glass box hanging on the side of a building was exhilarating! Amazing photo opportunity also to keep as a memory so don't forget to keep your phone handy. Definitely recommend while staying in Chicago.

Equally as impressive as the Sears tower, this gigantic building has impressive views of downtown Chicago and the Lakes.  I visited here the same day I visited the Sears tower when I was in Chicago. I had nothing better to do so I thought I would check out the views from both these buildings. The elevator ride was quick and fast. I was alone and had a great time as I pondered over downtown Chicago. It was cold and windy. Which ever skyscraper you climb in Chicago, the views will be good. I recommend day time over night time.

What a view! It's truly 360°Chicago. The lift took about 45 seconds and did not feel bad at all, only ears went locked few times. The best time to go is in a clear sunny day or evening, you can see miles and miles away. Some of us also tried the Tilt, very exiting... You can also take a glass of wine or bear or a cup of coffee in the 94th floor. And you can by photos of yourself if you want to.

I love the 360 at the John Hancock, and to be honest I think the view here is a lot better than the one at the Sears tower. The building is right next to the lake and you can see Chicago from a different perspective. 

The tilt ride is not that exciting, I did it once and found it kinda lame. 

I will definitely recommend going up before sunset you will love it !!!

Outstanding place for a chill out session with a fantastic drink in your hand. While you sip on your drink, you can enjoy unforgettable views of Chicago than are just spectacular. The experience is a bit costly but worth every penny. If you get hungry, there is a luxurious restaurant on the floor just below.

I loved visiting the John Hancock Center observatory. There are great views of the city, and it was fun to read about the construction and history of the building. I highly recommend getting a City Pass and using that to avoid the lines - we were up in the sky in 15 minutes, while others in line waited 1 to 2 hours.
I been in this building for last 5 and a half years and I'm happy.  The best part is a gym access.  Management is great.

Good place to park your car overnight if your staying downtown. I just recommend heading out super early. The god has issues directing to the location because the lot is underneath the prudential building.
Lots of choices and I love the underground pedway to access the train
Nice place!

I use the Beaubien Court entrance to Prudential Plaza to access the Metra station, right below. Just take the stairway down and you're in the Metra station. There is a Market Creations Cafe buffet that opens at 6:30 until 3 p.m., with the same entrance off Beaubien Court. I've never been in the Market Creations Cafe, but it looks interesting for breakfast. Open Monday through Friday 6:30 to 3 p.m. closed Saturday and Sunday.

The Magnificent Mile was on full tilt !
Saint Patrick's Day celebrations all over the city. Michigan Avenue and those 900 North Michigan shops and all the surrounding stores and restaurants wear packed with people celebrating Saint Patrick's Day and tourist from all over. I specifically went to The Cheesecake Factory for a birthday party what's at least 20 other people celebrating their birthdays as well. It was a really great evening and the stores stay open a little extra for tonight's festivities. I love Chicago

Jhon and I were here yesterday and it was our first time. I really like it here, the atmosphere felt like you were in a small 900 North Michigan Shops. It's not exactly the same as one but the way they built, it made sense. I like all of the bakeries, souvenir shops, restaurants and the large toy store. The toy store had lots of most Japanese/Asian toys. All of the food were really good. Nothing looked bad. Would go visit again.
This is a good place to go in Chicago to shop and dine. It has a lot of good stores and a wide selection of restaurants. The parking fee is also very reasonable.

It's a nice place to hang out here and the parking fare here also reasonable. There're many restaurants and market that can walk. On Saturday morning, this plaza is really crowded. And my hubby and I really enjoy the walk here.
Classic Mall in the modern reference looking forward to its transformation and staying relevant as malls transform, love the hotel love the residences

Due to a mix up on my part with my landlord my water was shut off yesterday due to the land lord ending service. As a pet owner with two large dogs and a cat as well as a roommate I needed the water back on quickly. I went in, signed up and explained the situation and within 3 hours my water was back on. I realize this is definitely not the norm as far as turnaround time and truly appreciate the extra mile these folks went to help me.

While I do understand that sometimes water outages happen, my whole neighborhood has been without water over 17 hours (and counting!) with no explanation and no update as to how long it would take to fix.  There was no natural disaster or major reason why our water should be out this long.  Living without water in your house is a major deal and some update should be given to customers.  I asked to speak to the manager after I got no update from the customer service rep, but she said that because I wasn't the primary account holder (I rent), I wasn't able to.  So that's why I'm leaving a review.  Aqua Texas, you really need to change your policies and better serve your customers.

I had three of their pipes deteriorate and leak in my backyard. I had to spend several hours waiting for the contractors they hired to come and repair the pipes all three times and they left my yard lob sided from the dirt they didn't level.

I called Aqua regarding a water leak on their main, near my neighbors house. I first noticed the leak almost four months ago. I finally caught the neighbor at home about two months ago and they said it had been reported. Aqua sent someone out to paint a blue mark indicating where the leak is at. This leak is still ongoing, possibly contaminating the community water supply. The response from the Aqua emergency phone number was "Sir, you'll have to call back Monday after 9:00". Called back only to hear them say there was no report of a leak at the address, and there was no such address on Lakeridge  Loop. Tried to help this neighbor, but sorry, they're on their own now. It may get fixed after a meter reader falls through a sink hole caused by the leak.
If I could give them zero stars, I would. I was on hold for a supervisor for over 20 minutes and still never spoke to one. Worst customer service!
Best upscale champagne breakfast. Great eggs benedict and waffles. We enjoyed it!
One of the great ones. Not only the looks are on point but also the staff is friendly, food is delicious. Definitely a place I'd come back to!
Our experience here was terrific. Wonderful view. Had a guest with us & they put up a very comfortable bed for her. Comfort all around. I recommend.
Good location, spacious rooms, tiny gym, modest pool. Service not so top notch considering our three still unsolved requests for a second bathrobe.

My review as posted on trip advisor:  
10!

Review of Waldorf Astoria Berlin
Reviewed December 4, 2016 

With a combined total of over 100 hundred trips to Europe, my husband and I have stayed in many five star hotels. However, the Berlin Waldorf Astoria is unparalleled in luxury, service, efficiency and comfort. From concierge, Mike, to server, Alexander, our every need was met prompt and courteous resolve. The rooms are beyond luxurious with amenities never imagined. The Waldorf Astoria enhanced our wonderful stay in a fascinating city. Thank you!

We are hoping to visit again this year.
The residents’ average age is quite old. And they have some stupid rules like ‘no water in the study room’. But the location is great
A great view of the city and the beach. I watched the airshow from a friend's condo.
The facilities for tenants and their guests are  superb.
My buddy lives there  awesome place too rich for me but he loves it  it's got everything you want inside   awesome views of  Lake  Michigan
Good food nice customer service and great prices.
Architecture is the claim to fame here.  A popular lobby bar, and a good basement breakfast & lunch cafeteria.
This is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city. And also if you are a batman fan this is the Wayne tower in the dark knight movie
Great art deco interior design. Good restaurants and shops.
Cafeteria on the lower floor of the building has excellent food and a great place to people watch.
Chicago Board of Trade - Chicago Mercantile Exchange in the Financial District, LaSalle Street Canyon, build 1930 Art Deco, topped with a three story aluminum statue of Cere, goddess of agriculture
Great place for pictures and the staff treats you like family.
Great people to work with.

Great hotel to stay at in Chicago.  It's in a perfect location, right next to the river and easy to get around.  The room itself was very spacious and clean, and the hotel building is really cool!  I definitely recommend staying here if you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel downtown.

Great experience! The room was gorgeous with picturesque views of Chicago. Lots of activity and entertainment in the lobby and within walking distance. Good food just a few steps from the front door. Very satisfied!

I love this hotel. I was lucky enough to be able to stay here for 3 months while I was on a temporary assignment for my company that has an office directly across the street in the Illinois Center.

By the end of my 2nd week I talked myself into a corner room Jr Suite.

I was able to experience just about about all the services offered from room service to laundry service. The concierge and doormen proved to be very helpful and knowledgeable about Chicago.

My company said I could fly back to my condo in downtown Seattle every weekend or stay in Chicago. I stayed in Chicago most weekends to explore the city!

I experienced great service the entire time I was there.

My only recommendation is that if you get a room where the shower has a big window like the one I had overlooking N Michigan Ave close the curtain otherwise you'll be giving a show to the office workers in the bldg across the street. ☺ 😉.

Like this place. I stay here on business and like the modern rooms. Lots within walking distance. Prompt service, quiet nights sleep with restaurant on premises. My coworkers love the ping pong table. Nice quick walk to Millennium park.

The lobby was wonderful and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had booked a standard room with two queen beds. When we got to the room is was really warm. We asked them to take a look at it and maintenance arrived right away and replaced the air filter. It helped a little, by the evening it had cooled to about 65, but then raised again to about 68. Honestly, I was expecting more for the price we payed. I felt that I would have had the same comfort and amenities at a 2 star hotel.

The building is very nice, all the people working desks are extremely nice, friendly and helpful. The elevators are interesting in that they are controlled by touchscreens in the center of the hallways of the elevator sections. Parking is convenient with a multistory parking garage connected to the building that the elevators can take you to, although driving from one level to the next takes you though very tight turns so expect to take special care here.

I'm a new patient of North Shore Medical Group and see my Orthopedic at this location. This review was done after my first ever visit here. ALL the staff in this department were especially nice, friendly and helpful. The doctor I seen was extremely nice and friendly. This man took his time and explained things to me in great detail and LISTENED. There was no feeling of being rushed and I was SO very impressed with the time taken. So far everyone who I've seen from North Shore have been extremely nice and took their time with me, but the Ortho stood out on this occasion.

So far I think everyone at this location are entirely friendly and nice.
Well they were a five star. But treasure island a full service grocery store just moved out. And just took with them their entire low life crew. Good riddance to your overly priced wares.
A few interior shops and a Walgreens, great architectural walk through

A very congested area, parking is an absolute premium , like $23.00 an hour
In the hospital parking lot. Too much congestion for me. Some of the pedestrians are a bunch of inconsiderate snobs , who think the rules of the road don't apply to them, one bit.  They will walk right in front of vehicles without looking, for their own safety. Yet you just hit one or tap one, because they walked in front of the vehicle, without looking, you will ser how quick they will contact their attorney and si you.

This is where my MD office is at. Parking in building is convenient but expensive. However if you purchase a minimum at Treasure Island you can get a validation for a certain amount of time. That being said, there are salons hardware store pharmacy grocery store in this building. If I lived here I would never even need to leave.
Great building. Unfortunately it was under renovation but, don't miss the lobby and the different stones and sculptures in the front walls. You would be surprised about the details you can find!!
Beautiful building. It's fun to inspect all the stones from famous places around the world

Miscellaneous office space leased from the remarkably ornate tower -but now I believe transitioning into residential units.  Cool concept.  Reliable meeting point for tourists and pedestrians which stops travel for quarter mile around DuSable Bridge.  The view here is remarkable.  Nobody's fault for appreciating.
Great. Wish it was retained for what it was built.... I understand it's being remodeled to house apartments. 7.3 billion & going strong..... got to house them all.

near Tribune maybe if you will be so nice to help WGN up with the sport the finals scores maybe they can get WGN back on here you don't believe me it comes on labor day with the labor day Marathon the telly

I'm trying to book a room here, anybody know how much a suite costs for 4 nights?
The hotel has a prime location, and a wonderful view of the rest of the city. I have waved at the guests playing basketball on the rooftop court, and they wave at me back! Very glad this hotel installs chainlink fences on the rooftop so nobody loses their basketballs or falls off the side of the building. Would love to stay here for an upcoming vacation!

This place does a good job keeping the criminals away
Sick rooftop views
Why are their reviews for a prison

Drew was so helpful with finding the right apartment for my boyfriend and me! We had quite the list of “must haves” with a tight budget and he found us the perfect place without any compromises. Can’t wait to move in!!

I lived at 111 in 2015 and it’s still my favorite apartment building in Chicago! You can’t beat the views of the river/lake and the amenities are stunning. They just opened a new yoga studio and it’s making me consider moving back in when my lease is up! Highly recommend this building.

One Eleven is the perfect place where to live in downtown Chicago. You got everything you need in a friendly and nice environment.
I enjoyed every single day there!!!
Beautiful building! Best in class in Chicago! I love the events OneEleven hosts every year, especially their St. Patty's Day Brunch overlooking the river.

Nothing beats the views and  location like Oneeleven! On top for that they have an amazing staff that is always willing to go above and beyond for you. I couldn't ask for a better building to live in non other than Oneeleven!
